class.name: BlipKitInterpreter
class.description:
Executes byte code generated with [BlipKitAssembler] to modify properties of a [BlipKitTrack]. [b]Example:[/b] Play instructions: [codeblocks] [gdscript] # Create the interpreter. var interp := BlipKitInterpreter.new()
# Get the byte from a [BlipKitAssembler]. var byte_code := assem.get_byte_code()
# Load the byte code. interp.load_byte_code(byte_code)
# Add a divider and run the interpreter on the track. track.add_divider("run", 1, func () -> int: return interp.advance(track) ) [/gdscript] [/codeblocks]

method.name: advance
method.description: Advances the interpreter until a [constant BlipKitAssembler.OP_TICK] instruction is encountered, or no more instructions are available. Returns a value greater than [code]0[/code] indicating the number of [i]ticks[/i] to wait before [method advance] should be called again. Returns [code]0[/code] if no more instructions are available. Returns [code]-1[/code] if an error occured. In this case, [method get_status] returns the status and [method get_error_message] returns the error message.

method.name: get_error_message
method.description: Returns the last error message. Returns an empty string if no error occurred.

method.name: get_instrument
method.description: Returns the instrument in [param slot]. This is a number between [code]0[/code] and [code]255[/code]. Returns [code]null[/code] if no instrument is set in [param slot].

method.name: get_register
method.description: Returns the value in register [param number]. This is a value between [code]0[/code] and [code]15[/code].

method.name: get_waveform
method.description: Returns the waveform in [param slot]. This is a number between [code]0[/code] and [code]255[/code]. Returns [code]null[/code] if no waveform is set in [param slot].

method.name: load_byte_code
method.description: Sets the byte code to interpret and clears all registers and errors. If [param start_label] is not empty, starts executing byte code from the label's position. The label must be set [code]public[/code] when adding it with [method BlipKitAssembler.put_label]. Returns [code]false[/code] if the byte code is not valid or the label does not exist. The error message can be get with [method get_error_message].

method.name: reset
method.description: Resets the instruction pointer to the beginning of the byte code, and clears all registers and errors. This does not clear instrument and waveform slots. If [param start_label] is not empty, starts executing byte code from the label's position. The label must be set [code]public[/code] when adding it with [method BlipKitAssembler.put_label]. [b]Note:[/b] This does not reset [BlipKitTrack]. Call [method BlipKitTrack.reset] to reset the corresponding track.

method.name: set_instrument
method.description: Sets the instrument in [param slot]. This is a number between [code]0[/code] and [code]255[/code].

method.name: set_register
method.description: Stores [param value] in [param register]. [param register] is a number between [code]0[/code] and [code]15[/code].

method.name: set_waveform
method.description: Sets the waveform in [param slot]. This is a number between [code]0[/code] and [code]255[/code].

members.member: The number of [i]ticks[/i] per [constant BlipKitAssembler.OP_STEP] instruction. The value is clamped between [code]1[/code] and [code]65535[/code].
